Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Prunus mume | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Bush clover (hagi) | blank3_name_sec1 = - Bird | blank3_info_sec1 = White wagtail | blank4_name_sec1 = | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 029-224-1111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 1-4-1 Chūō, Mito-shi, Ibaraki-ken 310−8610 | website = | footnotes = }} is the capital city of Ibaraki Prefecture in Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Mito" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 642. It has been recognized as a special city since 2001.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research (2011), Table 3; retrieved 2012-12-18. ==History== Mito was a major center of historical and philosophical studies during the Edo period.Nussbaum, "Ibaraki-ken" at p. 367. ==References== ==Other websites== * Mito City website Category:Cities in Ibaraki Prefecture
